info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 5:51PM EDT until July 14 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Miami-Dade.
* WHEN...Until 630 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 549 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate rains are still occurring over the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen from the earlier thunderstorms and rains. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area with the moderate rains. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Therefore, the Flood Advisory remains in effect until 630 PM EDT. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hialeah, Pembroke Pines, Miramar, Miami Lakes, Hialeah Gardens, Medley, Pennsuco, Palm Springs North, Intersection Krome And U.S. 27 and Country Club. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING
